page.title: 01Farmland north of Belton
page.content: 'Woodhouse' is an extensive area of flat agricultural land with a profusion of drains and ditches. These are a legacy of the drainage of the area by the Dutch engineer Vermuyden in the early 17th Century. The M180 travels east-west across the area and a junction is formed with the A161 Goole-Gainsborough road, one mile north of the village of Belton. The only residents of the area live in scattered farmsteads. One larger building is Hirst Priory. This once was a priory but is now a family home though the grounds provide the venue for a local cricket club.
